title: FPS locked at 60 no matter what
body:
Title^. I've disabled VSync, uncapped FPS, checked NVidia control panel and disabled Vsync globally, still locked at 60FPS. I don't want to hear that there's no need to go above 60FPS blah blah blah, I know that. I want to see my max FPS so I can adjust my video settings accordingly for a steady 60FPS stream (if possible).

I have an i7 4700HQ, GTX 860M 2GB GDDR5, 8GB RAM and a 256GB SSD. Occasionally when I alt+tab back into League my FPS will be uncapped momentarily and I will be around 225FPS but then it will decrease back to, and lock, at 60. I'm out of ideas. Any help is appreciated.

replies.body:
If you're running Windows 10, this is likely caused by the problematic *Game DVR* feature that Microsoft baked into their recent windows updates. You can disable this feature using [this guide](http://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/8637-game-bar-turn-off-windows-10-a.html) to see if it was the cause of your issues.

Let me know if this helped.

> [{quoted}](name=Targons Blade,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=E9lEMmE1,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2016-11-08T02:37:21.530+0000)
>
> If you're running Windows 10, this is likely caused by the problematic *Game DVR* feature that Microsoft baked into their recent windows updates. You can disable this feature using [this guide](http://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/8637-game-bar-turn-off-windows-10-a.html) to see if it was the cause of your issues.
> 
> Let me know if this helped.

Yep, that fixed it. Thank you so much.

> [{quoted}](name=Targons Blade,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=E9lEMmE1,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2016-11-08T02:37:21.530+0000)
>
> If you're running Windows 10, this is likely caused by the problematic *Game DVR* feature that Microsoft baked into their recent windows updates. You can disable this feature using [this guide](http://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/8637-game-bar-turn-off-windows-10-a.html) to see if it was the cause of your issues.
> 
> Let me know if this helped.

I am running Windows 10. I'll give that a try and report back here. Thanks for your help.
dont know if you have tried this, but for me once I capped fps it would not uncap in the same game. to fix this simply uncap and remove vsync and then exit game and reload. should be uncapped again

> [{quoted}](name=ZEXI0N,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=E9lEMmE1,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-11-07T20:14:03.579+0000)
>
> dont know if you have tried this, but for me once I capped fps it would not uncap in the same game. to fix this simply uncap and remove vsync and then exit game and reload. should be uncapped again

Yeah, I've tried that. I appreciate your response anyways though. Thank you.
